list.event: Host assembles before Gates of Minas Tirith. Go ENE through the Pelennor
Pass between Causeway Forts on the Rammas Echor. Follow Causeway east across the flatlands of the Anduin valley
Reach the western walls of Osgiliath. Pass through “ruins of Old Gondor.”
Use ferries and boat-bridges of the enemy to cross the Anduin
Continue through ruins of east Osgiliath. Pass new defense works
Infantry halts 5 miles east of the Anduin. Camps by the River Morgul
Horsemen continue up the Morgul-road east. It is straight, but climbing
Reach the Cross-roads by evening. Heralds proclaim the coming of the Lords of Gondor. No other sounds. Repair statue of the King. Camp
Leave a strong guard at Cross-roads: archers of Ithilien. Rest of Host moves north on the road. Send scouts ahead and on each side
Heralds proclaim the coming of the Lords of Gondor. Prince Imrahil suggests they say “King Elessar.” Weather fair, with west wind
Dark thickets rise from the tumbled land below the Ephel Dúath
Cross stream on a masonry bridge. Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Rest
Cross stream on bridge. Rest
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Camp by stream
Cross stream on bridge. Continue north on road
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Cross stream on bridge
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Weather still fair
Reach south end of long cut through out-thrust arm of the mountains
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar.
Host is attacked by Orcs and Easterlings (same place as Faramir had defeated the Haradrim). Well warned by scouts, they easily defeat the attack. Camp there by stream. Nazgûl overfly camp
Cross stream on bridge. Nazgûl continue to overfly
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Cross stream on bridge
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar.
Cross stream on bridge
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar.
Reach the point where the road turns northeast toward the Black Gate. Camp west of road, next to a stream
Swing northwest away from the road
Follow a dry stream-bed leading toward the Wetwang
Turn northeast, roughly paralleling the road
Rest. Reach the desert-like lands west of Mordor. See the beginnings of theDesolation of the Morannon. Aragorn dismisses the faint-hearted
Eat. Continue on, slowly
Camp
Continue northeast
Pass among the moors of the Noman-lands. Draw together. No scouts
Eat. Rest. Continue on very slowly. Expect attack, but none comes
Camp northwest of the Black Gates. All are wakeful. Sense that things prowl around them. No wind. Cold
Dawn. North wind rises. Turn southeast toward the Morannon
Pass among slag heaps and noisome pits
Early day: reach the Black Gate. Aragorn arrays Host on two hills of stone. Parley with the Mouth of Sauron. The Battle of Morannon. Barad-dûr and the Morannon collapse when the Ring is destroyed
